title: Turner as Inspiration
details: Exhibition of 31 watercolours by J.M.W. Turner, accompanied by watercolours and prints by artists influenced by Turner. Curated by Anne Hodge; held in the Print Gallery (free admission).

title: AIB Young Portrait Prize 2026
details: The annual AIB Young Portrait Prize returns in 2026, open to young artists aged up to 18; winners will be announced at a ceremony in November 2026 and the competition culminates in an exhibition in the Portrait Gallery. Curated by Sinéad Rice and sponsored by AIB.

title: AIB Portrait Prize 2026
details: The annual AIB Portrait Prize exhibition showcases contemporary portraiture by Irish artists; the winning artist receives €15,000 and a €5,000 commission for inclusion in the National Portrait Collection. Curated by Dr Brendan Rooney and organised by the National Gallery of Ireland.

title: Hilma af Klint: Artist and Visionary
details: The first major exhibition of Hilma af Klint’s work in Ireland, featuring paintings, drawings and watercolours that highlight her visionary abstract practice informed by spirituality, Theosophy and Anthroposophy.

title: William Blake: The Age of Romantic Fantasy
details: Organised in collaboration with Tate, the exhibition presents over 100 works by William Blake alongside paintings and drawings by his contemporaries, exploring Romantic imagination, fantasy and responses to a time of revolution and transformation.

title: Maurice Marinot – On Paper, In Glass
details: An in-focus exhibition of Maurice Marinot's works on paper and glass from the 1900s–1950s, featuring vases, flagons, bowls and paperweights that reveal his pioneering contribution to glassmaking; the display includes works never before exhibited at the Gallery and items gifted by his daughter in the 1970s.

title: Jan Steen: Sacred and Profane
details: Marking the 400th anniversary of Jan Steen’s birth, this special display brings together key masterpieces (including The Village School and The Marriage Feast at Cana) from international loans to explore his range from religious narratives to comic genre scenes.

title: Créatúir na Cartlainne | Tails from the Archive
details: A free exhibition drawing on the Centre for the Study of Irish Art archives to celebrate human relationships with animals—featuring works on paper, sketchbooks and illustrated letters, presented in four rotations.

title: From Rembrandt to Matisse – A Celebration of European Prints and Drawings
details: A special exhibition of around fifty European works on paper (drawings, prints, watercolours and photographs) from the National Gallery of Ireland collection, presented in celebration of Ireland’s Presidency of the Council of the European Union. Curated by Niamh MacNally.

title: AIB Young Portrait Prize 2025
details: An inclusive portrait competition and exhibition for artists aged 18 and under from across the island of Ireland. Twenty finalists across four age categories are shown in the Portrait Gallery.

title: AIB Portrait Prize 2025
details: A selection of shortlisted contemporary portraits from the AIB Portrait Prize are exhibited, with the winner receiving €15,000 and a commission for the National Portrait Collection. The show presents works in a wide range of media by artists from across Ireland and Irish artists abroad.

title: Picasso: From the Studio
details: A major monographic exhibition exploring Pablo Picasso's work in the context of his studios, from early Paris to Mas Notre-Dame de Vie in Mougins, featuring paintings, sculpture, ceramics, works on paper and audio-visual material. Organised by the National Gallery of Ireland in collaboration with the Musée national Picasso-Paris.
